thread.title: Linda Lusardi comforts daughter Lucy Kane as she's eliminated in The Voice UK battles
thread.title_full: Linda Lusardi comforts daughter Lucy Kane as she's eliminated in The Voice UK battles

author: Hayley Minn
title: Linda Lusardi comforts daughter Lucy Kane as she's eliminated in The Voice UK battles
text:
Linda Lusardi comforts daughter Lucy Kane as she's eliminated in The Voice UK battles Sir Tom Jones chose Nadine McGhee over Lucy Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Linda Lusardi hugs daughter as she's eliminated on The Voice Share this video Get celebs   
Linda Lusardi was left comforting her daughter Lucy Kane as she got eliminated from The Voice UK . 
The 58-year-old legendary former glamour model isn't the only one in the family to have talent as her 20-year-old daughter Lucy, whom she has with her husband Samuel Kane, had managed to get on to Sir Tom Jones' team. 
But she failed to make it any further in tonight's show, after losing out to Nadine McGhee. 
Lucy and Nadine sang Cyndi Lauper's Time After Time. (Photo: Rex Features) (Photo: Rex Features) (Photo: Rex Features) 
But Sir Tom chose Nadine over Lucy and none of the other judges Jennifer Hudson, Gavin Rossdale or will.i.am chose to steal her. 
Running offstage after, a disappointed Lucy gave her famous mum a huge hug. 
Lucy previously dazzled the coaches with her beautiful rendition of Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow. 
Both Sir Tom and Gavin turned for her, and she chose the Sex Bomb singer as her coach, confessing she "grew up with his music". Lucy Cane was so happy to get through (Photo: ITV) Lucy phoned her mum Linda Lusardi (Photo: ITV) Her mum was so proud! (Photo: ITV) 
She added her dad Samuel - who starred in Brookside - looks like him, saying: "You have the same shaped head!" 
Following her successful audition, she phoned her mum - who was over the moon. 
Crying with happiness, Linda said: "I'm so pleased, I love you so much and I'm so proud of you!" Linda Lusardi Lucy Kane performs The Shirelles' Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow (Photo: Rex Features) 
Lucy banned her parents from coming to the studio with her. 
Speaking about her first audition, Lucy shared: “I didn’t want my parents brought into it. I didn’t bring my mum and dad with me. I wanted it to be about me." 
She added to the Daily Star : "I didn’t want to only be Linda Lusardi’s daughter if I didn’t get through." 
Instead, Lucy opted to bring along her boyfriend Joe and brother Jack. 
The model also said she wouldn't be prepared to follow in her mum's footsteps and pose topless. 
Lucy told The Sun: "“I think it’s great that women are confident enough to do it and it is what it is. Lucy Kane performs The Shirelles' Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow (Photo: Rex Features) Lucy Kane performs The Shirelles' Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow (Photo: Rex Features) 
"I don’t mind underwear modelling at all. I’m confident in my skin. It’s my job. I’ve never gone topless. I just don’t think it’s for me.” 
While speaking about her mum, she added: “I’m proud of her. She looked stunning. She obviously spoke to me about Page 3 as she was worried how people would react at school. I did have a few boys say my mum’s a ‘Milf’ but everyone gets that don’t they?” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
